XIII.ii.2.A.1.e
.
Definition of “War” for Civil Service Veterans’ Preference
For Veterans’ preference, “war” refers only to those armed conflicts declared by Congress to be wars.  Another difference between
38 U.S.C.
and OPM regulations is that for
5 U.S.C.
Veterans’ preference purposes, World War II covers the period from December 7, 1941, through April 27, 1952.
38 U.S.C.
defines “period of war” and includes many non-declared wars, such as the Korean Conflict and the Vietnam Era.  Service purely during a period of war listed in
38 CFR 3.2
may not necessarily qualify a Veteran for civil service preference.
Reference
:  For more information on armed conflicts declared to be wars by Congress, see
50 U.S.C., Appendix
.
